meanings.definition: Make (something) smooth or even by rubbing or applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: She tried to besmooth the rough edges of the table with sandpaper.
meanings.sent2: I need to besmooth the frosting on the cake to make it look perfect.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to besmooth its fur by licking it all day long.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to besmooth the canvas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gentle waves of the ocean besmoothed the sandy shore.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the rough stone will besmooth with constant use.
meanings.sent2: The ice will slowly besmooth as the skaters glide over it.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy road began to besmooth after the recent repairs.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to besmooth as she gained confidence during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The river rocks besmoothed over centuries of flowing water.
